summary: Daniel Flores was a CIA employee, as evidenced by multiple documents. His Personal History Statement from 1961 details his background, education, employment, military service, and language skills. In 1975, the CIA's General Counsel requested he be excused from jury duty in Fairfax County to protect his confidentiality. Flores also swore an oath to support the Constitution in 1962, denying subversive activities. He also filled out a Supplemental Personal History Statement in 1974, providing updated personal details. He is also mentioned in a memo documenting the transfer of AMMUG to a new apartment in Silver Springs, Maryland, though his specific role in this event is not detailed.
significance: While the documents establish Daniel Flores as a CIA employee, their significance to the JFK assassination context is not explicitly stated. The documents primarily provide background information and administrative details about his employment. Further research would be needed to determine if Flores had any direct or indirect involvement in events related to the assassination.
